name: Holiday Inn Resort Wrightsville Beach

reviews.text: I live in this area, and although extremely close to the ocean, I don't live ocean front. Every once in a while my wife, 3 year old and I will take an overnight or weekend trip to Wrightsville Beach and the Sunspree is one of our favorites.
reviews.title: The Sunspree has the most to offer in the WB

likes.liked: — Isolation from everything else on the Island. It's on the North end with more residences than hotels.
likes.disliked: — I can't think of anything that was unpleasant to date.

reviews.text: There are building restrictions in Wrightsville that help keep overdevelopment from occurring and keeping the small town feel intact (as much as possible in the summer months). There are few "hotels" on the beach as you can tell, with most of the accomodations going to rental beach homes.
reviews.title: The Best on the Beach , but No Peace by the Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a "full service" hotel, then the Holiday Inn Sunspree is pretty much your only choice (except for the Blockade and it has just been sold to turn into Vacation Condo's). But it is a good choice.
reviews.title: Nice weekend getaway

likes.disliked: — Dated colors of wallpaper and carpet, but they are doing renovations now.

reviews.title: Lots of options for a family
reviews.text: They have recently done some renovations (winter 06) and have mutiple pools, and are right on the ocean front. This isn't truley a "resort" but a hotel that has pretty much everything you want in a rather isolated setting. Great lobby, we love Gabby the parrot, and the bar can be fun on a weekend night even in the winter months.

The rooms are better than your average Holiday Inn, we have stayed in a couple of nice ones with Whirlpools, small fridge/microwave, and a dining table. Some rooms have balconies overlooking the ocean.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Sunspree Resort Wrightsville Beach ROCKS!!!
A three-star that wants to be a four-star
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband and inlaws in mid-October in a King size room with a whirlpool tub. The view from this particular room was terrific since it was a larger room with two huge picture windows. The bed was comfortable and facilities adequate but not fancy. The whirlpool tub turned out to be right in the room which was a little awkward and less useable. The in-room coffee was terrible which is one of our benchmarks for a good hotel. The restaurant in the hotel was average hotel fare and we chose not to eat there which meant we had to drive for every meal. However, there was free wireless internete access, friendly service and clean rooms. There's a great outdoor pool and an indoor pool as well. The fitness center featured an elliptical trainer, two treadmills that weren't working an a recumbent bike along with a universal gym which was missing a few parts--not really suitable for someone serious about exercise. All in all, though, this is the best place to stay on Wrightsville Beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to the area, and instead of risking it by choosing a hotel with 'local color,' we chose the Holiday Inn, especially after learning it was relatively new.
reviews.title: Just what we needed!

reviews.text: We weren't disappointed! The staff were friendly and the room was great. We had a top floor room with a balcony and view of the ocean.
reviews.title: Delightful stay at the Holiday Inn Sunspree Resort, Wrightsville Beach

likes.disliked: — odors in hallways and indoor pool; exercise equipment is outdated

reviews.text: We enjoyed the NON SMOKING lounge with live music and also had a nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Great family hotel

reviews.text: The indoor pool was a nice treat since it was a little brisk our first day there. We didn't use them, but the outdoor pool was large and they had two hot tubs, and TONS of chairs for just laz-ing around.
reviews.title: Great experience at a well run property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Nice remodel however they missed some areas
Great Oceanfront Experience
reviews.text: If you are looking for a terrific oceanfront location with a fabulous beach, make your reservation. We stayed one week in a king oceanfront suite and were very happy. Views were outstanding, the restaurant food is excellent...inside or outside dining with ocean views. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet or order off the menu. There is a lounge and also a pool bar for coke, water, cocktails that also serves lunch. Oceanfront pool and inside pool and a kiddie pool. We were two adults but noticed many nice features for kids, kids spree activities, popsicles during the day at the pool, that kept the kids happy. The walks along the beach to look for shells is great and the beach is wonderful for walking. If you don't want to leave the resort, you needd not. We did have several dinners at other Wrightsville Beach restaurants. There are plenty of dining and shopping choices very near the resort. The airport is a short fifteen to twenty minute drive from the resort too. While we were there, we looked at some of the other choices and were confident we had made the right decision for what you get. We like to look at value instaed of just the rates. For the location and amenities, we feel this is a great value. (especially if you are travelling with children). There is also a great sundeck overlooking the ocean, so if you want to catch some sun and not be by the pool...you have your privacy. Plenty of lounge chairs so you need not worry. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Great family hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed at this property for a family reunion of sorts, booking three separate rooms.The staff is friendly and helpful, the location on the ocean can't be beat, and the food is EXCELLENT! As seasoned travelers from Connecticut, we were thrilled with the food (eating exclusively on the property) and Southern hospitality. The amenities for little children were outstanding (beachfront playground and kids club). We never had to leave the resort! Fun for every generation and we can't wait to come back next year!!!!

reviews.title: Decent for what was available but Way Overpriced
reviews.text: This hotel had pleasant employees but the hotel was very overpriced, rooms were of average care, breakfast was overpriced and the breakfast buffett set up wasn't efficient.

The hotel had entertainment and a few pools, indoor and out, but had little competition in the area. It was one of the better hotels but only because there were so few in the area. By hotel standards I would rate it average overall but VERY EXPENSIVE per night.
reviews.title: Good value for Oceanfront hotel
3rd stay
reviews.text: I'd recommend staying at another beach. Save your money, you can do better elsewhere!

aka: Holiday Inn Resort Wrightsville Beach Hotel
description: Welcome to the award winning Wrightsville Beach, NC hotel. This beautiful oceanfront hotel boasts pristine beaches, low key family fun, water sports and just plain relaxation. The Holiday Inn Resort, formerly known as the Holiday Inn SunSpree Resort, has all the comforts of home with fabulous views of the Atlantic Ocean. Our Concierge will schedule your massage or you can relax in the indoor and outdoor pools. This NC oceanfront hotel has something for all ages including a kids activity center (equipped with interactive gaming system), whirlpools, playground, bike rentals, and much more. Everything you need for your vacation in all within your reach.This NC Coastal hotel offers complimentary wireless Internet, 32 inch wide flat panel screen TVs in all guestrooms, full service restaurant/lounge and room service. The resort is conveniently located near shops, dinning, Historic Downtwon Wilmington, and the Wilmington New Hanover International Airport (ILM). Complimentary shuttle service is offered to many locations.The Holiday Inn Resort is within a short drive to Quintiles, Coldwell Banker Seacoast Realty, Mayfaire Town Center, Verizon, PPD, Autumn Hall, Wieland, General Electric, UNCW and Corning. Located at latitude 34.2198, longitude 77.7862.
